channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Lana Sinapayen
item.description: I have resigned from my position in eLife's Early Career Advisory Group. The ECAG works very hard to advance eLife's mission and represents a sizable portion of the organization's budget. We're not just randos sitting around doing nothing. It was an honor to serve such an innovative organization. The recent overblown, fabricated scandal brought the worst of academic politics to the surface. Mike was more gracious in his exit than I could ever be and I'm glad he'll never see my resignation email.

item.title: International Brain Laboratory
item.description: Going to SfN this year? Join us for a workshop on how to use the IBL Brainwide Map dataset to test your own hypotheses! For more information and to register, visit http://internationalbrainlab.org/sfn2023

item.title: Climatematch
item.description: üì£ Are you into climate science and social media? We‚Äôve got an opportunity for you! Help us draft messages like this one to get the word out about what Climatematch is up and share the awesome work we‚Äôre doing. Apply to draft our social media content here: https://academy.climatematch.io/volunteer#SocialMedia #volunteer #climate #Climatematch #Neuromatch

item.title: Jeffrey C. Erlich
item.description:
Is food addiction real? Apparently if it is ‚Äúultra-processed‚Äùhttps://www.theguardian.com/food/2023/oct/12/its-like-trying-to-quit-smoking-why-are-1-in-7-of-us-addicted-to-ultra-processed-foods
As Van Tulleken explains, ‚ÄúAddictive products are not addictive for everyone. Almost 90% of people can try alcohol and not develop a problematic relationship; many can try cigarettes, or even cocaine.‚Äù Equally, not everyone who eats UPFs will become addicted ‚Äì but, based on current studies, one in seven will. ‚ÄúMany UPFs for many people are addictive,‚Äù Van Tulleken summarises. ‚ÄúAnd when people experience food addiction, it is almost always to UPF products.‚Äù
#addiction #food #science #sugar #fat

item.title: International Brain Laboratory
item.description:
We are excited to present a Brain-Wide Map of neural activity during a complex decision-making behavior, a product of the monumental effort of 22 labs: 547 Neuropixels recordings in 267 brain regions from 115 mice collected in 11 labs üê≠ (1/8)
https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.07.04.547681v2
#neuroscience

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Working memory for different items linked to distinct beta phases. Theta phase coordinates beta activity, preventing memory conflicts.Rhythmic temporal coordination of neural activity prevents representational conflict during working memory
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2023.03.088
#neuroscience

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description:
JUDICIOUS MODEL ROBUSTIFICATIONReading George Box's 1979 paper that gave rise to the famous phrase "All models are wrong but some are useful."
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/B9780124381506500182That phrase is just so great. It's easy to see how it's counterpart slipped through the cracks. "Judicious model robustification" - who can claim not to aspire to that as well?To all modelers out there, may your model be judiciously robustified!#complexity #neuroscience

item.title: nature :press:
item.description: A mystery source of pollution fouling the Great Barrier Reef is found at lastNature, Published online: 17 October 2023; doi:10.1038/d41586-023-03221-0Nutrient-laced groundwater seeping up through the sea bed adds to an excess of nitrogen and phosphorus threatening the ecosystem. #presshttps://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-03221-0?utm_source=press.coop

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: Can you imagine ancient Japanese art for representing concepts from complexity science? Explore the results on #ComplexityThoughts https://open.substack.com/pub/manlius/p/complexity-science-meets-ancientEnjoy!#ComplexSystems #Complexity

item.title: PsychoPy
item.description: Did you know PsychoPy now supports plugins? If you want to use a #python library that isn't available in the standalone app, select "Get More" in builder and install plugins or packages!

item.title: vickerse
item.description: Happy to share my first preprint from the McCormick Lab!If you're interested in mesoscale 2-photon imaging and the relationship between neocortical activity and movement/arousal, check it out! A thread...üßµ #neuroscience #biorxiv_neurscihttps://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.10.19.563159v1

item.title: Robert ‚Äúthe Bobby Yaga‚Äù McNees
item.description: Physicist William Higinbotham was born OTD in 1910. During the Manhattan Project he was the Electronics Group leader at Los Alamos.In 1958, while working at Brookhaven Lab, he invented one of the first video games: ‚ÄúTennis for Two.‚Äù It ran on an oscilloscope.Image: Brookhaven

item.title: John Tuthill
item.description: I am proud of my lab's new preprint on how descending signals from motor circuits predictively suppress the output of fly leg proprioceptors during self-generated movements.https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.10.20.563322v1One of my initial goals when I started my lab was to use the fly to understand how the brain generates forward predictions of motor output. I think this brings us a step closer in that direction.Project led by phenomenal post-doc Chris Dallmann.

item.title: Teri Kanefield
item.description:
There is some confusion about Meadows "flipping."https://abcnews.go.com/US/chief-staff-mark-meadows-granted-immunity-tells-special/story?id=104231281Immunity is something else: This means essentially that he was forced to testify.It works like this: If the DOJ gives use immunity, nothing he says can be used against him, so it's no longer possible to invoke the 5th Amendment.(It's late so I'm not sure I explained it well.) See:
https://www.law.cornell.edu/constitution-conan/amendment-5/immunity#:~:text=‚ÄúTransactional‚Äù%20immunity%20means%20that%20once,from%20or%20obtained%20because%20ofhttps://www.justice.gov/archives/jm/criminal-resource-manual-718-derivative-use-immunity

item.title: Andrew Plested
item.description: Reading up on dyes, I see that the widely-used Alexa 594 performs poorly in #2Photon #imaging above about 850 nm. We want a dye that works well at 1040 nm. According to this nice @biophysj paper, it looks to me like A546 would be a good choice, at least twice as good as A594. Do you have a favourite? #fluorescence #cellbiology #neuroscience https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S000634951200063X

item.title: Robert Sanscartier
item.description: These Climate Solutions Could Get Us Halfway to Net ZeroOf the 90 potential climate solutions in Project Drawdown's tracker, reducing food waste has the greatest projected potential to cut emissionshttps://www.triplepundit.com/story/2023/evidence-based-climate-solutions/786641#MassExtinction #pollution #ecology #environment #climate
